revised_title: On the Inflexion of Light: A Hypothesis of Light as Material Particles
tldr: The author, John Barton, examines the phenomena of light inflexion and compares the appearance of shadows at different distances. He proposes a hypothesis that light consists of material particles with a power of mutual repulsion, which can explain the deflection and curvature of light rays. The author also supports this theory by the analogy of the laws of heat and light, both exhibiting phenomena of reflection, refraction, and polarization.
